thinking.disposable_income: Lazybrook/Timbergrove is an upper-middle-class neighborhood with median household income around $100,000, indicating relatively high disposable income and ability to absorb transportation costs.
thinking.discretionary_consumption: Residents have significant discretionary spending power and tend to prioritize quality of life, with many households able to afford multiple vehicles and regular retail/dining expenses.
thinking.accessibility: The neighborhood has good car accessibility with quick access to Loop 610 and I-10, moderate bus service along key corridors, but limited direct rail access, making most residents car-dependent.
thinking.decision_rationale: 1) Given high car ownership and income levels, policies with moderate driving fees are acceptable if they improve transit; 2) Higher sales tax is less impactful due to high disposable income; 3) Moderate transit fares balance system funding with accessibility; 4) Prioritized proposals that reduce car travel times while making transit more competitive; 5) Selected options that provide best overall time savings while maintaining reasonable costs for both modes.
